description: Demolition of St David's Court and erection of part three, five and six storey block containing 31 flats (8 x one bed, 17 x two bed, 5 x three bed and 1 x four bed) refuse stores, landscaping and car parking (alteration to extant permission PP/2012/3052, including the retention of the stairwell serving Portrush Court) (Deemed Consent by London Borough of Ealing)
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and documents:  Drawings: (2996a-D-) 001 P1, 002 P1, 003 P1, 010 P1, 011 P1, 012 P1, 013 P1, 014 P1, 015 P1, 016 P1, 030 P1, 032 P1, 050 P1, 052 P1, 053 P1, 054 P1, 063 P1, 064 P1; (2996A_L_) 901 P1, 902 P1, 903 P1.  Design and Access Statement, Ref: 2996a Golf Links Estate, prepared by Levitt Bernstein; Golf Links Neighbourhood regeneration amended Scheme Full Planning Application Planning Statement, prepared by Arc Planning; Energy Strategy, Ref: 25457 (Issue 01), prepared by Baily Garner; Code for Sustainable Homes Pre-Assessment Report, Ref: 26544 St David's Court (01), prepared by Baily Garner; Foul & Surface Water Drainage Strategy, Ref: SJC/615624/JRC, prepared by MLM Consulting Engineers Ltd; Transport Statement, Ref: 614600 and Covering Letter Ref: TC/615624/JIR, prepared by MLM Consulting Engineers Ltd;   Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interest of proper planning. | The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved Construction Logistics Plan and other documents approved under separate planning application ref: PP/2013/1755, dated 09/09/2013:  Construction Logistics Plan, prepared by Durkin (no date or reference), received 02/09/2013; Staff Travel Plan, prepared by Durkin (no date or reference), received 02/09/2013; Residents Introductory Letter (ref: DL/RJ/LE/802-D14, dated 15/04/2013.   Reason:  To ensure appropriate mitigation measures to protect the amenity of local residents and ensure adequate highway and site safety, in accordance with policies 5.18, 6.3 and 7.15 of the London Plan 2011; 1.1(f) and 1.1(j) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012 and policy 7A of Ealing's adopted Development Management DPD 2013. | Details and samples of all facing materials shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to any work commencing on the superstructure of the development.  The samples and details shall include:  a) brickwork (including brick panels and mortar courses); b) cladding materials; c) all window treatments (including sections and reveals); d) building entrance details and material samples; e) balcony structures and balustrading treatment (including sections);  f) privacy screen treatment to balconies;  g) residential, bin store and bicycle store entrance doors / ventilation louvres;  h) any other materials to be used.  The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the details so approved.   Reason:  Whilst the main facing materials have been specified in application ref: PP/2013/3518 in pursuance of the discharge of planning condition 5 of planning permission P/2012/3052 and are considered to be acceptable, further details of the arrangement of the materials are required in view of the alterations to the design of the part three to six storey high apartment building; in the interest of securing sustainable development and to ensure that the resulting appearance of the development is of a high standard in accordance with policies: 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan 2011; 1.1(h), 1.1(k), 1.2(f), 1.2(h) and 4.1 of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012 and policies 7B and LV7.4 of Ealing's adopted Development Management DPD. | The approved hard and soft landscaping, tree planting and boundary treatments shall be provided in accordance with the details illustrated on drawings (2996A_L_) 901 P1, 902 P1, 903 P1 and described in detail at Sections 6.1 - 6.6 of the Design and Access Statement ref: 2996a Golf Links Estate, prepared by Levitt Bernstein.  All landscaping shall be completed / planted during the first planting season following practical completion of the development hereby approved.  The trees or shrubs to be planted as part of the approved landscaping scheme which are removed, die, become severely damaged or diseased within five years of completion of the development shall be replaced with the same species within the next planting season.  All boundary treatments shall be provided in accordance with the approved details prior to the first occupation of the development.  Reason:  To ensure the approved landscaping is provided as an integral feature of the development and that all such landscaping, boundary treatments and street furniture is retained in the interests of the setting of the buildings and visual amenities of the locality; to provide biodiversity within the site, in accordance with policies 5.10, 6.10, 7.2, 7.3, 7.4, 7.5, 7.19 and 7.21 of the London Plan 2011; policies 1.1(e), 1.1(h), 1.1(i), 1.1(k), 1.2(f) and 1.2(m) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012 and policies LV 5.10, LV 7.3, 7B and 7D of Ealing's adopted Development Management DPD. | The biodiversity roofs shall be provided in accordance with approved drawings 2996a-D-016 P1, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The biodiversity roofs shall comprise the following:   a) biodiversity based with extensive substrate base (depth 80-150mm);  b) sufficient depth of soil or growing medium for the relevant planting, including the re-use of any demolition material where feasible; c) planted / seeded with a mix of species within the first planting season following the practical completion of the building works. The seed mix shall be focused on wildflower planting and shall contain no more than 25% sedum; d) relevant efficient and effective drainage and irrigation to sustain the vegetation.  The biodiversity roofs shall not be used as an amenity or sitting out area and shall only be accessed in the case of essential maintenance or repair.  The biodiversity roofs shall be provided prior to the first occupation of the relevant part of the development to which the biodiversity roofs relate.   Reason:  To ensure the development provides the maximum possible provision towards the creation of habitats and valuable areas for biodiversity in accordance with policies 5.3, 5.10, 5.11, 5.12 and 7.19 of the London Plan 2011; 1.1(j), 1.1(k) and 1.2(m) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012 and policy LV 5.11 of Ealing's adopted Development Management DPD. | The car parking as indicated on the approved drawing 2996a-D-010 P1, including a minimum of 4 parking spaces suitable for wheelchair users, shall be marked out and completed together with the associated access roads and manoeuvring areas prior to the first occupation of the development and these areas shall be kept continuously available for car parking associated with the residential development and shall not be used for any other purposes.  Reason: To ensure adequate car parking is provided and retained in conjunction with the development in the interests of the general amenities of the locality and the free flow of traffic and conditions of pedestrian and general highway safety on the neighbouring highways in accordance with policies 6.3 and 6.13 of the London Plan 2011; policies 1.1(f) and 1.1(g) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012 and policy LV 6.13 of Ealing's adopted Development Management DPD. | Within six-months of the commencement of development a draft Travel Plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. As part of the Travel Plan measures, the introduction of a car club vehicle within the application site shall be further investigated and evidence of this investigation shall be submitted with the draft Travel Plan.   A final detailed Travel Plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the first occupation of the development. A car club vehicle shall be provided in accordance with the approved details if such provision is found to be viable.   The final Travel Plan shall be implemented prior to the first occupation of any part of the development.   Reason: In the interest of supporting measures that encourage shifts to more sustainable modes of transport, in accordance with policies 6.1 and 6.3 of the London Plan 2011; policies 1.1(f), 1.1(g), 1.1(j) and 1.1(k) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012. | Within 6 months of the commencement of the development the details of the bicycle storage facilities, comprising at least one cycle storage space for the approved one and two bedroom flats and two cycle storage spaces for the three and four bedroom flats shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval.  The bicycle storage facilities shall be provided in accordance with the details so approved and be ready for use prior to the first occupation of the relevant part of the development which the store serves.  Reason: To ensure adequate cycle parking storage is provided within the development in pursuance of the objectives of sustainability and encouraging the use of modes of transport other than private motor vehicles, and to ensure that the design and location of the bicycle storage areas does not detract from the design and appearance of the proposed development and also does not visually dominate the forecourt of the approved houses;  in accordance with policies 6.9, 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan 2011, policies 1.1(h), 1.1(g) and1.1(k) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012. | The dedicated refuse / recycling enclosures illustrated on approved drawing 2996a-D-010 P1 shall be provided prior to the first occupation of the relevant part of the development which the enclosure serves.   Reason:  To secure the necessary recycling and waste enclosures to support the development and to ensure that responsible waste management practices are adhered to in the interests of the visual amenity of the area and in accordance with policy 5.17 of the London Plan 2011; policy 1.1(e) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012. | The residential units shall be constructed to Lifetime Homes Standards, in accordance with the Design and Access Statement and the plans hereby approved.  Reason:  To ensure that the development is adaptable, flexible, convenient and appropriate to the changing needs of the future occupiers, in accordance with policy 3.5, 3.8, 3.9 and 7.2 of the London Plan 2011; policy 1.1(h) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012 and policy LV 3.5 of Ealing's adopted Development Management DPD 2013. | The four wheelchair accessible units shall be constructed to conform to the guidance set out within the Habinteg Wheelchair Housing Design Guide (Second Edition), in accordance with the Design and Access Statement and plans hereby approved.   Reason:  To ensure the provision of wheelchair housing that would address the current unmet housing need; produce a sustainable mix of accommodation; and provide appropriate choices and housing opportunities for wheelchair users and their families, in accordance with policies: 3.5, 3.8, 3.9 and 7.2 of the London Plan 2011; policy 1.1(h) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012 and policy LV 3.5 of Ealing's adopted Development Management DPD 2013. | The passenger lifts located within the communal cores serving the approved apartment building shall be installed and operational prior to the first occupation of the flatted development, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.   Reason:  To ensure that adequate access is provided to all floors of the development for all occupiers and visitors including those with disabilities, in accordance with policies 3.5, 3.8, and 7.2 of the London Plan 2011; policy 1.1(h) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012. | Internal noise levels of the residential units, due to external noise or noise from other parts of the development should not exceed the following:   Bedrooms (23:00 to 07:00 Hrs): 30 dB LAeq, 45 dB LAmax for individual noise events   Living rooms (0700 to 2300 Hrs): 35 dB LAeq.   Kitchens, bathrooms, WC compartments & utility rooms (0700 to 2300 Hrs): 50 dB LAeq.   [NB: All time intervals are 1 hour, time weighting is fast unless stated. Note: The levels above are recommended by the World Health Organisation and incorporated within BS8233 1999: Sound Insulation and Noise Reduction for Buildings - Code of Practice.  Reason: To ensure a satisfactory standard of residential amenity is provided for future occupiers, in accordance with policies 3.2 and 7.15 of the London Plan 2011; policy 1.1(j) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012 and policy 7A of Ealing's adopted Development Management DPD 2013. | Details of site-wide security measures shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the first occupation of the development.  The details shall relate to:  a) CCTV; b) general lighting; and/or   c) security lighting   The details shall include the location and full specification of: all lamps; light levels/spill; cameras (detailing view paths); and support structures.    The proposed external lighting scheme shall comply with the advice given at BS 5389 Part 9, with regards to upward light and light pollution and lighting of public amenity areas and ILE guidance on Reduction of Obtrusive Lighting 2005.  The general security measures shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the details so approved and shall be installed prior to the first occupation of the development.   Reason:  To ensure that the security lighting and CCTV cameras are appropriately located and designed to not unduly affect the residential amenity of the occupiers of the development and neighbouring properties; are appropriate to the overall design of the development and are adequate to promote safety and security, in accordance with policies 7.3, 7.6 and 7.13 of the London Plan 2011, policy 1.1(e) and 1.1(h) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012 and policy LV 7.3 of Ealing's adopted Development Management DPD 2013. | Details of security features relating to each of the communal residential entrances of the approved development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority within six months of the commencement of the superstructure works. The security details shall relate to:  a) location, access and design of post-boxes, which should be external (unless otherwise agreed with the Local Planning Authority); and b) design, location and details of entry systems.  The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the details so approved and maintained as such thereafter.  The agreed security features shall be installed prior to the first occupation of the development.  Reason:  To ensure that the security details relating to the residential communal entrances are appropriate and adequately secure in accordance with policies: 7.2 and 7.3 of the London Plan 2011; policies 1.1(e) and 1.1(h) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012. | All residential units shall be constructed to achieve a minimum Code for Sustainable Homes Level 4 of the Code for Sustainable Homes (based on November 2010 Technical Guide). No development shall commence on the development until evidence that the development is registered with the Building Research Establishment (BRE) under the Code for Sustainable Homes and a CfSH Interim Design Stage Assessment is submitted to the Local Planning Authority for information.  Within 3 months of the commencement of the development, CfSH Interim Design Stage Certificates verified by the BRE will be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval.  No residential dwelling shall be occupied in the development until a CfSH Post-Construction Stage Assessment has been submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval, confirming that the agreed sustainability measures will be achieved.  Within 3 months from the date of first occupation of the development, Post-Construction Stage Certificates verified by the BRE will be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval confirming that the agreed sustainability measures have been implemented.   Reason: To ensure a sustainable living environment is secured in accordance with policies 5.1, 5.2, 5.3, 5.5, 5.6, 5.7 and 5.9 of the London Plan 2011 and policy 1.1(k) of Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy 2012. | Prior to first occupation of the approved development, carbon dioxide emission reduction measures shall be incorporate into the development to achieve the carbon emission savings in accordance with the approved Energy Statement (Issue 01, dated 25th October 2013) prepared by Baily Garner :  a)	Be Lean Stage: energy demand reduction measures to achieve at least a percentage of 0.78% in carbon dioxide (CO2) emissions savings over BR Part L 2010 b)	Be Green Stage: incorporation of on-site solar Photovoltaic panels to achieve at least a percentage of 26.29% in carbon dioxide (CO2) emissions savings over Be Lean stage.  The carbon emission reduction measures should be calculated based on regulated carbon dioxide emissions covered by the Building Regulations 2010.    Reason:  To ensure that the development hereby approved is energy efficient and to contribute to the avoidance of need for new fossil fuel or other primary energy generation capacity and to reduce emissions of greenhouse gases, in accordance with policies 5.2, 5.3, 5.6 and 5.7 of the London Plan 2011 and policy 1.1(k) of Ealing's adopted Development (Core) Strategy 2012. | Details of the scheme of photovoltaic panels, which shall provide for no less than 23kWp (equivalent to 26.29% on-site C02 reduction) as detailed within the approved Energy Statement (Issue 01, dated 25th October 2013) prepared by Baily Garner, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the practical completion of the development. The details shall include: 	 a)	The resulting scheme, machinery/apparatus location, specification, operational and technical details; b)	Scaled and elevation plans of the resulting scheme showing that the modules have been installed with suitable orientation and free of shading.              The approved photovoltaic scheme shall be installed and operational prior to the first occupation of the development.  Reason:  In the interest of sustainable development and combating climate change, in accordance with policies 5.2, 5.3, 5.6 and 5.7 of the London Plan 2011 and policy 1.1(k) of Ealing's adopted Development (Core) Strategy 2012. | Upon final completion of the development, suitable devices for the monitoring of the solar Photovoltaic equipment shall have been installed, and the monitored data shall be submitted to the local planning authority at daily intervals for a period of three years from final completion of the renewable/low carbon energy equipment. The installation of the monitoring devices and the submission of the data shall be carried out in accordance with the Council's approved specifications.  Reason:  To monitor the effectiveness of the renewable/low carbon energy equipment in order to confirm compliance with energy policies and establish an evidence base on the performance of such equipment, in accordance with policies 5.2, 5.3, 5.6 and 5.7 of the London Plan 2011 and policy 1.1(k) of Ealing's adopted Development (Core) Strategy 2012. | The development hereby approved shall be provided in 100% 'affordable housing tenure', as defined at Appendix 2 of the National Planning Policy Framework, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To ensure that the development is provided in accordance with the approved plans and documents and in order that the development meets the requirements of policies 3.11, 3.12, 3.13 and 3.14 of the London Plan 2011 and policy 1.2(a) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012 and policy 3A of Ealing's adopted Development Management DPD.
